cmps.network.NetworkSetting.title: Network Setting
cmps.network.NetworkSetting.description: Base Ports determine the starting port numbers that will be used for each node. When a network is started, Polar will use these values to detect the next open port on your machine to assign to the nodes. You usually do not need to change these unless you are running into port conflicts with other apps installed on your computer. If you change these values, try to maintain at decent size gap (roughly 100) between them to prevent them from overlapping as more nodes of each implementation are added to your networks.
cmps.network.NewNetwork.tapdCountError: The number of Taproot Assets nodes must be less than or equal to the number of LND nodes
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.tableTi: Wrap the variables below in double braces to use them in the command
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-nam: The generated name of the node (ex: alice)
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-con: The generated name of the docker container (ex: polar-n1-alice)
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-bac: The generated name of the Bitcoin node that the Lightning node uses as a backend (ex: backend1)
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-rpc: The RPC username used to authenticate to the backend Bitcoin node
The RPC password used to authenticate to the backend Bitcoin node
The encoded RPC authentication string used to specify the password for the backend Bitcoin node
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-ecl: The API password used to authenticate to the Eclair node
cmps.nodeImages.CommandVariables.var-pro: The name of the node to use as the TAP proof courier. This will be the first Terminal node in the network.
